title: An appropriate Yasuo windwall nerf
body:
I think we can all agree on one thing, Yasuo is not a fun champ to lane against. He is a lane bully and a late game monster, and on top of it he is not gated by mana or energy. As frustrating as he is we aren't going to get him gutted or put into the dirt by some of the nerfs proposed because they are unreasonable. 
One of my main frustrations with him is his wind wall. As someone who plays a lot of ranged spell casters this is something that infuriates me to no end. Many times you can perfectly predict what he is going to do and send out a stun, or your jungler casts a cocoon and just a millisecond before it hits him his wind wall comes out. Because it originates from the center of his model, it will block everything from where he is to the max range. 
I am proposing making it so the wind wall STARTS at the max range instead of it coming from the center of his model. This means that those well timed cc can actually hit him when he doesn't wind wall in time. It also makes sure that he can't just purge any projectile near him. 
This will allow players to be able to punish him with well timed cc and punish Yasou players who don't think about how to use wind wall properly. 
What do you think?

replies.body:
I think his Windwall should use up his Flow. He does not need 2 ways of stopping damage, not on a champion with so much raw damage and mobility.  

The size and duration of the windwall will depend on how much Flow he has, I think about 75% Flow should be his current Windwall and 100% can even go on longer to compensate (or maybe not if it isn't needed). If his Shield activates he can't use Windwall anymore, if he has 0 Flow somehow (and his shield is not active currently) Windwall will still come out but it will instantly go away. Meaning he can still use it as a reactionary ability to protect himself if he is good enough.
this would make him unplayable in mid lane because he would not be able to trade with anyone

Yasuo is one of the strongest laner's in mid lane, but it's not because of his windwall it's cause of his passive, it prevents the player from recognizing yasuo's actual power, its near impossible to gauge what a yasuo can do. It blocks a SHIT TON of things and if the player was forced to use one or the other that would make gauging yasuo's power in lane much easier, it certainly wouldn't make him useless because his kit has so many other things over other champions that it doesn't really matter. 

With this change if i auto attack a yasuo and take out his shield with Katarina, that means i can go in since he doesn't have windwall. If he uses his windwall then all i have to do is wait it out and i can go. But right now if a yasuo wants to they can simply windwall at any time to stop 90% of most mid laner's kits in their tracks and then still have a passive shield that recharges REALLY fast. A yasuo player can have his passive up 3 times in a fight and do you know how incredibly detrimental that is?

Yeah. People don't realize how bullshit his scaling is, and that it is mostly because of his passive. It allows him to just rush PD and gain ridiculous stats from it, far outscaling what it normally would, and should, on any other champion. His windwall is a joke compared to how broken his passive is and how it scales him.

He is a nightmare in lane because of all the extra free shit he gets from his passive, and it only gets worse as the game goes on. Late game Yasuo's passive is worth:
50% crit chance = 2000g
510 HP Shield x 2 = 2719g

4700g of stats from his passive. And these are MULTIPLICATIVE stats, so their effectiveness will scale off of any of his items, such as Phantom Dancer giving him triple multiplicative scaling (Crit chance multiplies his AD, his passive multiplies the crit chance, and the % damage reduction multiplies off of his shield) 

For a late game example, Level 18 Yasuo with no other items besides PD and IE will get these stats from PD:
30% critical strike chance = 1200 Gold x2 from passive = 2400 Gold
45% attack speed = 1125 Gold
5% movement speed = 197.5 Gold
Passive 1: Ghosting
Passive 2: 7% movement speed = 276.5 Gold
Passive 3: 12% damage reduction ~= 12% total effective hp when fighting a single target

12% total hp comes out to be
1912 base HP at level 18
1020 HP from shield
12% of that HP = 351 HP = 938 Gold

Add that all up and you get... 4937g worth of stats, for an item that costs 2550 gold. Yes he doesn't unlock these stats right away, but the multiplicative scaling is insane. That's 193% gold efficient WITHOUT any other items, though thats at level 18.
But let's take his common build, he usually gets Frozen Mallet and Guardian Angel.

Frozen Mallet gives 700 health and GA gives 60 Armor + 45 MR.
This is a combined gold value of 3876g. 12% of that = 466g. 

Oh wait but he builds Bloodthirster too! It will multiply off of the lifesteal AND the shield.
20% life steal = 750 Gold
350 shield = 933 Gold
12% = 200 more gold. 

Let's get a total again: PD will grant a full build Yasuo ~5600 gold worth of stats, meaning its 220% gold efficient. It's over 3000g of free stats added. And that's not even counting the Ghosting passive from PD which lets him walk through units. Oh, and the bonus effective "HP" that he gets from PD's damage reduction vs his target is of course, unaffected by % health damage, % missing health damage, armor/magic pen, or anything else.

During the laning phase, he doesn't have all of this power unlocked, however, it gradually goes up and even if he is massively behind, it doesn't matter because his scaling is ridiculous. And god save you if he is ahead lol. But yeah in mid levels even if he got destroyed in lane, he picks up PD as his first item anyway since its so obscenely broken on him, and he functions perfectly fine, and can even outperform a fed enemy. Stupid. And late game, well we all know how stupid he is then.

It seems like the problem is PD as an item then, rather than Yasuo, in this case? It's pretty commonly known that PD is extremely powerful as opposed to the other Zeal items, especially for Yasuo, since he's a duelist who has everything to gain from the item. But even so, it's just a problem item, on a champion that makes great use of it. This is such a common theme lately, with itemization pushing a champ too far, and then people complaining about champs rather than itemization, even if DIRECTLY TALKING ABOUT ITEMS (Read: Tank Ekko). 

There are some issues with Yas, but making a drawn out explanation on why PD is super powerful then using it to complain about one of the champs that uses the items, isn't necessarily proving anything about the champ themselves, just that they happen to benefit from an OP item. It's just like complaining about Shyv/Yi/Xin when devourer was strong instead of the item itself, even if it was obviously Devourer pushing champs over the edge.

Also, 12% Damage Reduction is NOT equal to 12% extra HP. Lower damage numbers aren't touched by it nearly as much as larger numbers, making DoT or weak, fast attacks more effective than burst, and you get no benefit against true damage.

PD is too strong, but Yasuo is also too strong. If they nerf PD he will find and abuse another item that will end up being nerfed instead of him. They need to stop nerfing/buffing problem champions and instead look at what makes them so strong. Yasuo's Windwall and Flow Shield are too reliable for him and offer nothing to his opponents except that he is allowed to make mistakes and they are not.

His mistakes still have high cooldowns early game, that any poke mage can work around after breaking the shield with a ranged auto, and either baiting out the wall with some random ability/autos, or just dealing good damage to him within the window his shield is down. 

They're fairly strong abilities, but people act as if there's absolutely no counterplay. Learn to play the champ, and you'll be able to work around them with ease - given you aren't counterpicked (Vel'Koz gits fucked) or the Yasuo isn't a god.

His Windwall does have a long cool down that is true, but its still a toxic ability. If you play around his windwall, its not because you did good but because Yasuo failed to properly use it. If you play around his shield its because he failed. That is just the kind of toxic champion he is, and I am not saying he is OP or imbalanced, just that his kit removes any sort of fun in dueling him. He is always at an advantage over majority of champions.  

If we change the Windwall to be less reliable we can lower its cool down while retaining the true use of that ability, to block CC. HIs flow shield I would be happy if they just removed it, but that is me being overly hateful of the champion, my suggestion allows him to keep it as is but he needs to pay attention to his Flow.

I mean, I do agree that we should change Windwall in some capacity, but honestly the only thing I really dislike about it is that it gets the free full-body block on cast, which makes it so you can still fuck up the direction and get the block anyways.

Aside from that, it's not like it's absolutely impossibly difficult to fucking make a Yas burn a wall, or force him to take damage if he refuses to wall. If it wasn't clear, I play Yas a lot, he's definitely one of my mains, and whenever I'm against him, not only do I counterpick if I can - because he has a LOT of counters that are oft played - but it's easy to bait out walls and take out his shield if you're a ranged caster. And if you're a melee, it really just depends, but some of the common ones mid - Zed, Ekko, Talon - can work well against him as long as you play around Yas properly.

Especially the latter, you literally just need to auto him once to remove his shield if you're ranged, and that's not really that difficult to do. If he REALLY wants to keep his shield up, he'll have to back up - thus losing CS - or he'll have to Windwall it, which is really just a waste in most cases.

You can't really remove his shield the way he is now, because he is incredibly squishy, which most people seem to forget. If you made the wall more reliable but harder to use - something like an instacast that blocks everything like normal, but only hits in front of him for a split second, and works on charge system.

That's just my fave idea, but something along those lines could definitely work out as a change that would make him harder to play for people that aren't good at him, and potentially make him better for the people that are actually good at him, which most people don't complain about anyways.

I am not doubting you play him a lot, but I have faced him many many times and two things that are always consistently annoying are his Flow Shield is rarely ever down at a certain point and his windwall can be damn near impossible to punish most of the time.  

His Flow Shield has far more counterplay to it than his Windwall, its the only part of his kit that is up to both you and him to play around. Windwall on the otherhand, well if he uses it and is punished, he didn't use it correctly. Its just that kind of ability, i mean he can just stand on it and be immune to ranged attacks from all directions. Combined with his insane damage, mobility, and decent CC it can be hard to "play around" him using his Windwall because he doesn't pay for it. He retains all his damage, mobility, CC, and Flow Shield but now he is immune to ranged attacks. He needs to pay for it, he needs to lose something for using it, just like pretty much any other champion that isn't toxic by design.  

Not saying my idea is the best, it was more to get my point across. Plus if you change or remove anything from yasuo that opens up room to give him things that are strong but actually balance-able.

 You can easily do this with most ranged midlaners, and while it does cost mana, as long as you stay warded and vigilant, you can pretty much just freely trade with him, with little he can do, as long as you understand how far you need to stay, and STAY AWAY FROM YOUR MINIONS.

There are so many problems with this. Firstly it would be too hard and frustrating to deal with such an inconsistent ability. Not to mention Yasuo players would have to start obsessively keeping track of their flow bar. Also, the optimal usage pattern for his W would always be to tank a hit with his shield first so as not to waste the flow, and then use the miniature windwall; imo very awkward. And when he actually needs the full windwall for a teamfight, it may not be available due to some stray AoE. I'd call that a finicky bitch of an ability.
Just like almost every other champion has to manage a resource bar? So unfair.
Tell me of any other champ that has to manage a resource bar that disappears because they took 1 tick of damage
The trade-off is, Yasuo's doesn't run out with every ability he uses. All resource bars have multiple mechanics, not just the provided idea for Yasuo's.

Here's the thing, there is NO resource bar in the game (as far as I know) that can be depleted by the enemy doing something.

Thats the reason mana burn isn't a thing in this game. It's toxic to deal with, and borderline unfair.

I always wanted Flow to be more of a resource Yas manages than a one-time shield. I'd love to see this change BUT coupled with increased Flow generation on Sweeping Blade being brought back and the ult instashield being scrapped. He'd generate more flow and have to make decisions on when and how to use it.

I would definitely agree w/ this change.  Would also prevent yas throwing up a windwall to save himself or a low teammate from something like a veigar ult that was thrown 1 sec before.

The current windwall gives him too much reaction time.  with this it would still be a counterplay tool but a higher skillcap one.

imo they should make up their mind on what his windwall should be: A reactive defense tool or a zoneing tool. Roght now it is both, and that is pretty frustraiting to deal with.

If they want it to be a reactive tool, they should keep it as it is but reduce the duration to 1sec and decrease the cd further with each rank, so it no longer prevents ranged(projectile based) champions from doing anything for ~4sec.
If they want it as a zoneing tool, it should only start blocking projectiles once it reaches it's maxrange, with probably a bit higher delay than it has now, so he can no longer reactively screw a combo.

Another change that would already help alot would be if the faceing of the wall finally matters, so walking around it actually allows you to attack instead of yasuo just walking through it and beeing save again.

However, any nerfs to him most likely need some compensation buffs as he's not directly to strong, just annoying to face.

Why not make his windwall like Braum's unbreakable??
Just nerf the damage of abilities and projectiles that go through it

Then it will block the first projectile incomming so it still will work as a reactionary tool.

I don't really care having it block a ability or projectile, but all of them for four seconds... it makes me salty.
Especialy when he just fucks up placing it... or me finaly playing arround it and have him just walk trough it and done. Its just too bullshit that i can fuck up a whole combo that easily. Or denied doing damage for soo long it makes no sense.

I do like them being different, since the two are different champs with different uses. However, having Wind Wall just be better than Unbreakable in every situation is lame. I think that putting some sort of extra restriction on Wind Wall, as you suggest, would be good, but I don't think this specific fix would be that great.

It isn't better in every situation.

Windwall is stationary, while Braum can run around with Unbreakable as he sees fit.
Yes, he can, but the size of yasuos windwall really diminishes that advantage that braum has.
What's pisses me off is that I can block 360 degrees if timed right. He could windwall the other way and still block a skill shot because it originates from his model.
I think the OP's suggestion would fix that problem.

I have an idea for his windwall: Increase its length, but mae it does absorb projectile, but purify them of their secondary effects. Example, it could remove the snare of Lux cage, or any oh-hit modifiers of autoattacks of that. 

It wouldnt change the nature of a spell though, for example the spliting of Vel'Koz would not be affected, it would (just) remove the slow and the passive stack.
That's actually a really cool idea. It keeps wind wall's purpose of weakening/deleting projectiles, but without devastating players with bad timing.
